clinical_study.brief_title: An Algorithm for Intra-operative Goal-directed Haemodynamic Management in Non-cardiac Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: An Algorithm for Intra-operative Goal-directed Haemodynamic Management in Non-cardiac Surgery - a Feasibility Study

brief_summary.textblock: A systematic literature search a goal-directed haemodynamic algorithm was created. The hypothesis of this study was that the goal-directed haemodynamic algorithm is feasible and can improve clinical outcome.

detailed_description.textblock: After a systematic literature search a goal-directed haemodynamic algorithm was created. The algorithm was adapted to international standards and consensus was reached through a modified Delphi method at international meetings. The feasibility of using the algorithm for intraoperative haemodynamic management was tested and the resultant clinical data analyzed retrospectively for several types of surgery with the hypothesis that the goal-directed haemodynamic algorithm is feasible in the clinical setting and can improve clinical outcome.

primary_outcome.description: The perioperative hospital length of stay is assessed.

secondary_outcome.description: The perioperative need for ventilator therapy is assessed.

secondary_outcome.measure: monetary reimbursement for prolonged hospital stay
secondary_outcome.description: The monetary reimbursement for prolonged hospital stay is assessed to evaluate the impact on financial consequences.

patients treated within a goal-directed haemodynamic algorithm intraoperatively

study_pop.textblock: Patients undergoing a surgical repair of hip fractures, open right hemicolectomy and extended hemicolectomy, radical tumor debulking in primary ovarian cancer or a pylorus-preserving pancreatic head resection.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing a surgical repair of hip fractures, open right hemicolectomy and extended hemicolectomy, radical tumor debulking in primary ovarian cancer or a pylorus-preserving pancreatic head resection at the Charité - University Medicine Berlin, Campus Virchow Clinic
- 18 years and older
Exclusion Criteria:
- emergency procedures
